intro: Hilsenbergia croatii, commonly known as the Croatian hilsenbergia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
